title: Putin to visit Ankara for talks with Turkey, Iran
text:
April 2, 2018 / 10:05 AM / Updated 2 hours ago Putin to visit Ankara for talks with Turkey, Iran Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin will make a two-day visit to Turkey from Tuesday where he will meet his Turkish counterpart Tayyip Erdogan and Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, the Kremlin said on Monday. FILE PHOTO: Russian President Vladimir Putin (R) shakes hands with his Turkish counterpart Tayyip Erdogan during a news conference following their talks in Sochi, Russia May 3, 2017. REUTERS/Alexander Zemlianichenko/Pool/File Photo 
Putin and Erdogan will also officially launch the first unit of Turkeyâ€™s Akkuyu nuclear power station, the Kremlin said in a statement. Reporting by Maria Kiselyova; Writing by Chrisatian Lowe; Editing by Susan Fenton
